intro: Schinus discolor, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Anacardiaceae family, which includes other plants like the cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, red berries that attract birds and other wildlife. Schinus discolor can grow as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 15 meters in suitable conditions. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly serrated edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
